introduce.description: Scenarios are core tools for API and UI automation testing, enabling orchestration of complex business processes and user stories. Compared to single test cases, scenarios support multi-step, multi-process complete testing workflows.
introduce.capability3: Quickly generate test scripts and tasks

messages.noAddedScenarios: You haven't added any scenarios yet,
messages.noFavoritedScenarios: You don't have any favorited scenarios
messages.noFollowedScenarios: You don't have any followed scenarios

tooltips.createTestTask: Generate functional, performance and stability test tasks.
tooltips.restartTestTask: Update task status to 'Pending', related statistical counts and status will be cleared.
tooltips.reopenTestTask: Update task status to 'Pending', without clearing statistical counts and status.
tooltips.deleteTestTask: Delete functional, performance and stability test tasks corresponding to the interface.

messages.deleteConfirm: Deleting the scenario will synchronously delete associated follows, favourites, metrics, variables and other information. Please confirm whether to delete 「{name}」?
messages.reopenConfirm: Reset all completed task statuses under the scenario to "Pending Test", preserving historical statistical data and status records. Confirm to reopen test task 「{name}」?
messages.restartConfirm: Reset all completed task statuses under the scenario to "Pending Test", clearing all statistical counts and status records. Confirm to restart test 「{name}」?

tips.authOn: After enabling "Permission Control", you need to manually authorize service permissions to have corresponding operation permissions for scenarios. "Permission Control" is enabled by default. Note: If the authorized object does not have parent directory permissions, view permissions will be automatically authorized.
tips.authOff: After enabling "No Permission Control", all users will be allowed to publicly view and operate the current scenario. Users viewing need to have current scenario parent directory permissions.
tips.testTaskInfo: Automatically generate corresponding tasks when scenario test tasks do not exist. If tasks already exist, current test information will be overwritten.

radioOptions.useDefault: Use Default (Default server configuration in scenario)
radioOptions.modifyConfig: Modify Variable Configuration (Will update to interface and variable server after modification)

permission.description: Configure data operation permissions for scenarios for specified users. By configuring permissions, you can more efficiently complete debugging, management, testing and other interface work in team collaboration.

tips.authOn: After enabling "Permission Control", you need to manually authorize service permissions to have corresponding operation permissions for scenarios. "Permission Control" is enabled by default. Note: If the authorized object does not have parent directory permissions, view permissions will be automatically authorized.
tips.authOff: After enabling "No Permission Control", all users will be allowed to publicly view and operate the current scenario. Users viewing need to have current scenario parent directory permissions.

edit.monitorNamePlaceholder: Enter monitor name, up to 100 characters
edit.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter monitor description, up to 200 characters
edit.notificationHint: After enabling notifications, messages will be automatically sent to recipients when monitoring runs fail.

detail.executionRecordsHint: Note: Only shows the last 100 monitoring records.

list.noMonitors: You haven't added any monitors yet,
list.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete monitor 「{name}」?

introduce.description: Scenario monitoring helps you track system status in real-time, quickly identify and resolve issues, improving system reliability and user experience. Main application scenarios:

apiDelay.title: API Delay Monitoring
apiDelay.description: Monitor API response times to ensure good user experience. E.g.: Monitor payment API response time under 500ms.

healthCheck.title: System Health Check
healthCheck.description: Quickly detect system running status. E.g.: Check component status in health check endpoints (/health).

apiFunctionality.title: API Function Validation
apiFunctionality.description: Regularly test API functionality correctness. E.g.: Automatically verify user registration API account creation process.

businessProcess.title: Business Process Monitoring
businessProcess.description: Monitor core business process integrity. E.g.: Verify consistency between payment orders and amounts.

scenarioTrash.title: Trash

tips.adminOnly: Only administrators and deleters can restore or permanently delete trash data.

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this item?
confirm.deleteAll: Are you sure you want to permanently delete all items?

scenarioTrash.description: Only administrators and deleters can restore or permanently delete data from the trash.
